E. W. Dijkstra

Specific Course Material for COMP-251
as taught by Godfried Toussaint

1. The Complexity of Algorithms:

    Models of Computation (Old and New)

    (1) Knotted Strings, the Abacus and other Models of Computation

    1. Gravity as a Computer:
      1. Computing the Centroid of a Polygon with a Plumbline
      2. Centers of Gravity of Polygons
    2. The Knotted String Computer
    3. Pythagoras' Theorem:
      1. Pythagoras' Theorem (An award winning proof and interactive Java applet demo)
      2. Animated Proof of the Pythagoream Theorem by M. D. Meyerson
      3. A Hinged Dissection Proof of the Pythagorean Theorem
      4. Other Dissection Proof s (with interactive Java applets)
      5. More than forty other proofs of the Pythagorean theorem
      6. The Converse of Pythagoras' Theorem
    4. The Abacus
      1. The Abacus in various number systems
    5. Napier's Bones in Various Bases
    6. The Virtual Museum of Computing
    7. Links to History of Computing

    (2) The Straight Edge and Compass

    1. Francois Labelle's Tutorial on the Complexity of Ruler and Compass Constructions (with interactive Java applet)
    2. GRACE (A graphical ruler and compass editor)
    3. The straight-edge and compass
    4. Constructive geometry of the Greeks
    5. Geometric constructions
    6. Geometrography and the Lemoine simplicity of geometric constructions
    7. Euclid's Elements
      1. Second Proposition (Java applet)
    8. Euclid of Alexandria
    9. More Euclid on the Web
    10. Relative computing power of models of computation:
      1. The Collapsing Compass
      2. A New Look at Euclid's Second Proposition (PostScript) (PDF)
      3. The Compass without straight edge (Mohr-Mascheroni)
    11. Heron's Shortest Path via a Line (with interactive Java applet)
      1. More on Heron's problem and other constrained shortest path problems (with interactive Java applets)
      2. More about Heron of Alexandria
    12. The Lunes of Hippocrates
      1. More about Hippocrates of Chios
    13. Wonders of Ancient Greek Geometry

    (3) Modern Models of Computation

    1. Introduction to Turing machines
      1. Fantastic Turing machine applet!
    2. The Turing Machine and Random Access Machine (Luc Devroye's class notes)
      1. More about Alan Turing
      2. Ceiling and Floor Functions
      3. Logarithmic functions
      4. The harmonic series
    3. Big "Oh" Notation (Luc Devroye's class notes)
    4. Basic analysis tools (Goodrich & Tamassia text)
    5. Computability theory
      1. What computers can't do (Turing and the Halting Problem)
    (4) The Complexity of Algorithms and Problems:
    1. Recursion (Luc Devroye's class notes)
      1. Algorithms for computing the Fibonacci function (David Eppstein)
      2. Fibonacci numbers (mathematical properties)
      3. Fibonacci numbers and nature
      4. Fibonacci Home Page
      5. Biography of Leonardo Fibonacci from Pisa
      6. Fibonacci numbers and domino tilings
      7. Vibonacci numbers
      8. Recursion solving applet
      9. Proofs of Binet's formula
    2. Lower Bounds (Luc Devroye's class notes)
